verb.description: (of an event or fact) cause or bring about (an action or feeling)
examples: his death has prompted an industry-wide investigation of safety violations

verb.description: Assist or encourage (a hesitating speaker) to say something.

noun.description: An act of assisting or encouraging a hesitating speaker.
examples: with barely a prompt, Barbara talked on

noun.description: The time limit for the payment of an account, as stated on a prompt note.

examples: the owner would have died but for the prompt action of two paramedics

origin: Middle English (as a verb): based on Old French prompt or Latin promptus brought to light, also prepared, ready, past participle of promere to produce, from pro- out, forth + emere take.
